alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 14 at 3:45AM EDT until March 14 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting 40 to 50 mph at times. * WHERE...Carbon. * WHEN...Until 6 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Any lingering areas of rain will transition to mainly snow heading into the day Tuesday. The highest snow amounts will be in the higher elevations above 1000 feet while in the lower elevations amounts will be lower due to the change over from rain to snow taking a bit longer because of warmer temperatures
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
